intro: Codonoprasum viridiflorum, commonly known as the green-flowered codonopsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically greenish in color. The plant produces small, oval fruits that contain several seeds. It is native to certain regions of Asia and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Due to its unique floral structure and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
